China's invisible workforce powering the platform economy
subhead: Service, delivery and mobility apps are shaping China's new economy. In a society with minimal safety nets, they promise frontline workers higher incomes, at the price of long hours and extreme physical effort.

Deadly Hong Kong fire kills at least 94 amid growing concern over renovation safety
subhead: The ongoing blaze has affected a complex of buildings containing 2,000 apartments. The buildings were under renovation and surrounded by bamboo scaffolding, which likely contributed to the flames' rapid spread. More than 250 people remain missing.

title: Israeli Army is reviewing the filmed shootings of two Palestinians who had surrended
subhead: On Thursday, the Israeli army and police said that they were reviewing an incident in which two Palestinian men were shot and killed in the West Bank after surrendering to Israeli forces. Videos circulating in the news and on social media show the two men advancing with their hands raised before shots ring out.

title: Louvre pushes up prices for non-EU visitors by 45%
subhead: From 2026, visitors from outside the European Union, Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway will have to pay €32 – an extra €10 – from January 14.

title: Filippo Sorcinelli, the man who dresses the pope
subhead: The Italian designer is one of the Vatican's preferred tailors. At 50, he has dressed the last three popes, including Leo XIV. Catholic and gay, he has patiently – and indulgently – observed the slow evolution of the Church.

title: Forgotten Louvre security report highlighted specific balcony used by crown jewel thieves
subhead: Le Monde has learned that a 2018 security audit explicitly identified the balcony used by the thieves as a point of vulnerability, even noting the possibility that a freight lift could be used to access it.

title: Boualem Sansal: 'At my age, I am not about to learn to hold my tongue...'
subhead: The French-Algerian writer, who has been in France since November 18, has regained his freedom, including his freedom of speech. He recounts his yearlong detention in Algeria, discusses the remarks that led to his arrest, and reflects on the future of relations between France and Algeria.
